title: Mass Layoffs at HHS Health Agencies - 20,000+ Public Health Workers Cut
summary: Trump administration slashed approximately 20,000 positions across HHS health agencies (25% reduction from 82,000 to 62,000 staff). FDA lost 3,500 positions including entire communications team and 800+ drug evaluation staffers. CDC lost 2,400 positions including disease detectives. NIH cut 1,200 positions. Cuts eliminated veterinarians, toxicologists, microbiologists, Lead Poisoning Prevention Branch, and FDA's Division of Food Processing Science. Stakeholders warn FDA's food safety capacity disproportionately weakened.
keyFacts: HHS staff reduced from 82,000 to 62,000 - nearly 25% reduction (20,000 positions)
FDA: 3,500 positions eliminated including entire communications team
FDA: 800+ staffers laid off from Center for Drug Evaluation and Research
